tweet:
Thank you @AmericanLiver for delivering the Distinguished Public Service Award. 

I am honored to be recognized by a group who advocates daily for over 30 million Americans who suffer from Liver disease & I am proud to be the sponsor of the LIVER Act! pic.twitter.com/7vS1CVdu1i

Thanks @PeteHarrisonNYC. All of us must make our voices heard to reverse the decades of disinvestment that's weakening our public housing and @NYCHA. https://twitter.com/PeteHarrisonNYC/status/1123314808743432197 …

Combating the climate crisis is a moral imperative that compels us to act to ensure we live in and leave behind a healthier, safer and more sustainable world for our children and grandchildren. #ClimateActionNow

Have electronic images of submissions for the Congressional Art Competition. 

Some great submissions this year -- very exciting! 

Stay tuned for an announcement on a winner, soon! pic.twitter.com/5rdQ5T6cdZ

My thanks to friends from Charles B. Wang Health Center @CBWCHC & @HepBFoundation for visiting today to discuss vital public health issues. Very timely during #MinorityHealthMonth. We must work together to secure federal resources so all our communities have needed medical care! pic.twitter.com/fPGzlKJil0

The American Society of Civil Engineers gave our country’s infrastructure a ‘D+’ grade 👎. That’s why I’m supporting @RepTedLieu @CongressmanRaja @RepCharlieCrist resolution calling for a bold investment in U.S. aging infrastructure to create #MillionsOfJobs #ForThePeople.

In 2019, we’ll be celebrating the 100th Anniversary of Congressional passage of the 19th Amendment granting women the right to vote. Yet our rights are STILL not guaranteed in our own Constitution. It’s an outrage! #ERAHearing #ERANow

Saddened by the passing of former Congresswoman Ellen Tauscher. All who knew her will remember her as a force for good in the world who used her leadership skills to make America safer and fight for our democracy. 

I hope her family may take some solace in her many contributions

It’s long overdue that we guarantee long-term care for our elderly and people with disabilities. That's why I'm proud to join @RepJayapal, @RepDebDingell and over 100 of our colleagues in support of the #MedicareforAll Act.
This #MinorityHealthMonth, I am standing with the @OfficialCBC, @HispanicCaucus, and @CAPAC to fight systemic health injustices in our communities. Who’s with me?

One third of Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are limited English proficient. This #MinorityHealthMonth, we must recommit to providing culturally & linguistically competent health services for the #AAPI community.

FACT: Latinos are more likely to suffer from:
🔴Diabetes
🔴Liver disease
🔴High blood pressure
🔴Obesity
🔴Asthma
🔴Cancer
This #MinorityHealthMonth, let's pledge to reduce racial and ethnic health inequities in the Hispanic community.
Thank you @Pwr4PuertoRico for hosting an important discussion today on the harmful effects of austerity measures on Puerto Rico’s people and recovery. pic.twitter.com/P2mK4mPLXZ

It is beyond appalling that @realDonaldTrump's Administration would be spying on those opposed to his abhorrent policy of ripping babes from children's arms. Congress needs to follow up, investigate the facts and hold this Administration accountable. https://bit.ly/2vt8vdi

This week and every week, #WeRemember Jewish and other victims of Nazism with our vigilance today against neo-Nazi and White Supremacist. 

Now more than ever, we must stand together against hatred, bigotry and anti-Semitism. 

#HolocaustRemembranceWeek

Even @realdonaldtrump’s own EPA is acknowledging the growing dangers of climate change! 

We need to #ActOnClimate which is why this week @HouseDems will pass #HR9 -- to block Trump from pulling the U.S. out of the Paris Agreement. https://wapo.st/2LaI2M1

My thoughts are with Senator Lugar’s family, his friends, former colleagues and all who knew and loved him. 

All Americans should honor his many years of service.
My thanks to Pat Foye of @MTA for working with us and getting behind this proposal

Proud to join @RepMaxRose & @RepJerryNadler in announcing legislation to allow split tolling on the Verrazzano bridge. This will mean less congestion and better air quality throughout BK, Manhattan and Staten Island. Time to get this done! pic.twitter.com/Ckvu31tSHh
I am sickened and saddened by what appears to be another act of hatred at the Chabad of #Poway synagogue on the last day of Passover.Hate has no place in our country..#StayStrong

It was my honor tonight to join colleagues @RepJerryNadler @RepYvetteClarke @RepMaloney for a town hall on the #GreenNewDeal. 

New York can lead the way to a more sustainable future!
#GND4NYC pic.twitter.com/JoWJYvlijb

NYers - don't forget service changes to the L Train are starting at 8 pm tonight.

Thanks to all those who attended my Census 2020 round table today. 

Having the right count means New York will receive the federal resources it deserves! pic.twitter.com/4NIXYO5FnH

Once again the Administration of @realDonaldTrump is putting polluters' interests ahead of the environment and the public health. This is unacceptable & I'll be working with my colleagues to oppose this flawed rule! https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/25/us/epa-chemical-standards-water.html …

As measles outbreaks affect communities in the U.S. and around the world, we must work with our global health partners like @MeaslesRubella, @Unicef, and @Gavi to support lifesaving immunizations and stop diseases at their source. During #WorldImmunizationWeek, #VaccinesWork.

It is my hope that @AmericanAir and other companies that contract with Eulen look into these charges and think carefully about how doing business with them affects their reputation.

If these news reports are true, they are deeply disturbing. It appears this company Eulen America has a track record of abusing some of the most vulnerable employees, including recent immigrants, and interfering with their basic right to unionize. https://cbsloc.al/2XAfr4j

This is indeed a "really big deal" - in the sense that it would intimidate immigrant communities and deprive New York & other cities of federal dollars they deserve. We'll fight this in Congress, as well as the Courts, @realDonaldTrump!! https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1121010431819173888 …

Don't know who could so heartlessly steal a 12-week old kitten, but I truly hope "Sage" is returned safely! https://patch.com/new-york/chelsea-ny/pet-store-offers-1000-reward-stolen-kitten-named-sage …

If the Title X gag rule went into effect it would have banned doctors & nurses in the Title X program from referring patients for abortion and threatened access to health care for millions of patients nationwide. Relieved the courts have issued an injunction to block this rule.

On #WorldBookDay, I encourage you to grab a friend & head to the nearest @nypl near you! 

May you find literature to ignite your creativity. NYC is beautiful in spring -- a great day to read a book outside!

Dear NY 7 high school students -- don’t miss your chance to have your art displayed for one year at the U.S. Capitol. I encourage you to submit your art and show off your talent! 

See flyer below for more info: pic.twitter.com/MhfiSk6n4M

By attempting to add a citizenship question to the #2020census, @realDonaldTrump & his Administration are attempting to distort the results and silence voices of many. Everyone deserves to be counted and we'll keep fighting for that outcome! https://wapo.st/2VXxi4C

Since taking the majority, @HouseDemocrats have treated every day like #EarthDay.
🔹Intro of HR 9 for #ClimateActionNow
🔹Created @ClimateCrisis committee
🔹Hearings on #ClimateChange 
We’re fighting to #ActOnClimate.

Was proud to participate today in Server for an Hour to help call for one fair wage and legislation to #RaiseTheWage. 

Thank you @rocunited and Marlow & Sons for hosting us! pic.twitter.com/63uPLtEimm

(2/2) I'll continue working with my colleagues in Congress to support a #GreenNewDeal, remove dangerous toxins and pesticides from commerce, ensure adequate funding for Superfund and to tackle other environmental challenges.
(1/2) On this #EarthDay it's more important than ever that we come together to address threats to our planet & our communities.
Horrified and saddened by the tragedy in Sri Lanka. To see such loss of life on a holy day is doubly heartbreaking. I pray for all those affected and hope for kindness and healing.
To all my friends and neighbors observing Passover, I want to wish a Zeesen Pesach and a joyous celebration with family and friends.
Congratulations to Randi Weingarten of @AFTunion for offering bold new ideas today on empowering teachers and improving education! https://twitter.com/AFTunion/status/1118869333529235456 …

We cannot rely on AG Barr’s analysis regarding obstruction of justice and other potential wrongdoing. It is more important now than ever that the full unredacted report and underlying evidence be given to Congress and Mr. Mueller testify before Congress. #ReleasetheReport

The Attorney General has demonstrated he is not acting independently of the White House and is in effect acting as the President’s attorney - not the nation’s chief law enforcement official. This is wholly unacceptable and risks undermining the rule of law.

I previously led several of my colleagues in writing the #PuertoRico Oversight Board, urging them to recoup fees from big banks on invalid debt. 

Today it was reported they don't intend to do so. 

That's unacceptable & I'll be following up. 

Read my full statement below. pic.twitter.com/gK5N32iLOK

Is @realDonaldTrump's Administration targeting for deportation the spouses of Americans who gave their lives fighting for our country? 

This seems to be the latest, most troubling example of how these morally bankrupt policies are harming people. https://bit.ly/2UnLySy

Thanks to our efforts in Congress, the @USDA has closed down its kitten experimentation lab and is adopting out surviving cats. 

I’ll keep working with my colleagues to ensure your tax dollars aren’t spent hurting animals. https://bit.ly/2ZbCp3j

The images we are seeing of #NotreDameCathedral fill us all with profound sadness and deep compassion for our French brothers & sisters and Catholics worldwide.We can only hope that as much as possible of this cultural site is preserved & can be restored for future generations!
So heartbreaking to see the fire unfolding at the Notre-Dame Cathedral. I truly hope the damage to this historical landmark can be minimized!

1/2 On this #TaxDay large corporations, big pharma, mega banks & the wealthiest among us are celebrating enormous gains they saw from #GOPTaxScam but working families, students and seniors don't see much benefit at all.

By attempting to politically weaponize a national tragedy, not only does @realDonaldTrump risk inciting violence but he devalues the lives lost on 9/11. 

This is beneath the office of the presidency, immoral and unacceptable. 

Our national discourse must be better than this!
To predatory landlords and equity investors your time is up #universalrentcontrol now! https://twitter.com/RidgewdTenantsU/status/1117074098243493888 …

- Introduced legislation to raise min. wage to $15/hr.

As I've said before, #JudyClark has paid her debt to society & been rehabilitated. She has spent nearly four decades incarcerated making positive contributions, helping other inmates. It is time to parole her and I hope the Parole Board makes the compassionate choice to do so.

Like so many, I was heartbroken to hear of the loss of this hero, a NYer who dedicated himself to our city & our nation. I hope his family finds some solace in knowing our entire city mourns with them. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/nyc-firefighter-among-3-u-s-service-members-killed-afghanistan-n992406 …

Today in Nat. Resources Committee, we questioned officials about next steps  to repair Puerto Rico's ailing electrical system.  @NRDems pic.twitter.com/GdhX6g4VFQ

I’m proud to support the #SaveTheNet Act, a 3 PAGE bill that enacts common-sense #NetNeutrality protections to safeguard a free and open Internet. @HouseDemocrats are taking action #ForThePeople to ensure a free and open Internet.

During the first #100DaysForThePeople, we’ve introduced legislation to protect voting rights, fight climate change, ensure #LGBTQ rights, and #ProtectDreamers. Can’t wait to see what the next 100 days has in store!
Looking out my window this morning and I see concerned citizens with a clear message for my colleagues. Couldn't agree more: release the #fullreport. #MuellerReport. pic.twitter.com/NxHYaYd35Q

I've led my colleagues from NYC Cong. delegation in requesting additional funds for @HUDgov & for public housing in Fiscal Year 2020. 

After years of disinvestment, we must restore funding for public housing capital fund and operational fund. pic.twitter.com/A9USkGfNou

With three #Superfund sites in my district - Gowanus Canal, Newtown Creek and Wolff-Alport - I'm calling on my colleagues for additional fed'l funds to clean up environmental sore spots here in NYC & around the country. pic.twitter.com/3GB31Pe2C5

During the first #100DaysForThePeople, the House has passed:
-H.R. 1, the #ForThePeople Act
-H.R. 7, the #Paycheck Fairness Act
-H.R. 8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act
And there’s more to come on issues including #LGBTQ equality & #Dreamers!
The fight for a free and open internet continues in the people's House as Democrats work to #SaveTheNet. Proud to be a part of @EnergyCommerce’s historic markup.
Proud to co-sponsor the #SaveTheNet Act which delivers popular, bipartisan #NetNeutrality protections to defend consumers and small businesses from abusive corporate practices.

From passing the #ForThePeople Act to voting to reauthorize #VAWA, our Democratic majority has been making the best of the first #100DaysForThePeople. Looking forward to all that will come in the months ahead!

My thanks to @pcrelationship for assisting those affected by the #SunsetPark fire! New Yorkers help each other in the face of adversity and always will! https://twitter.com/pcrelationship/status/1107467493914935296 …

I find it alarming that Kirstjen Nielsen, someone who worked to implement @realDonaldTrump's anti-immigrant "zero tolerance" policy is leaving because she's not extreme ENOUGH for this Administration. We must continue hold the Administration accountable!

For years the Navy used Vieques for military training, dropping explosives, resulting in enormous cancer rates. Now the least our gov't can do is build a new medical facility. Our gov't has a moral responsibility to address environmental degradation there! https://nyti.ms/2IiMc1o
This tragedy is heartbreaking but I am always inspired how NYers help one another in times of crisis.
Thank you to United Senior Center CERT, Salvation Army Sunset Park, Church of the Redeemer, World Harvest Community Center for their cooperation in organizing supplies and donations.
Today I visited Church of the Redeemer where families affected by the Sunset Park fire have gathered to receive help & donations. pic.twitter.com/VOolsnfASG
Was a pleasure to join @adhikaar today at their annual gala to discuss immigration issues & many other matters important to our community! Thanks for having me! pic.twitter.com/Zg8OA90PsG

NYers come together in tough times and lend a helping hand. Proud of our local small business, Sunset Bagels, for donating breakfast for those displaced by the Sunset Park fire. You exemplify what it means to be a good neighbor! 

Thank you!

The Trump administration is trying to force #Dreamers to live in fear by threatening their legal status. Don’t let them. Two federal court injunctions hold #DACA in effect. If you’re a DACA recipient eligible for renewal, please update your status today→ https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/deferred-action-childhood-arrivals-response-january-2018-preliminary-injunction …

#DACA has helped over 800K legally work, go to college, and build successful lives here in the US. #Dreamers are a part of our community -- they’re our neighbors, family, and friends. If you are a #DACA recipient, please, renew your status today→  https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/deferred-action-childhood-arrivals-response-january-2018-preliminary-injunction …

Hundreds of thousands of our neighbors, colleagues, and friends are at risk of losing their legal status in the US. As I fight to #ProtectTheDream in Congress, all #DACA recipients must keep their status up to date. Renew yours today →  https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/deferred-action-childhood-arrivals-response-january-2018-preliminary-injunction …
If the @GOP really becomes the "party of healthcare" as @realDonaldTrump has promised, will insurance plans have to cover “wind turbine cancer” as a preexisting condition?

Today, @HouseDems will make great progress For The People as we pass a bipartisan, robust, long-term Violence Against Women Act reauthorization.#VAWA funded programs provided legal assistance to an average of 28,553 victims every 6 months. We must continue this vital service!

1.3 million individuals participated in VAWA-funded education, awareness, or prevention activities. That’s why @HouseDemocrats kept their promise and fought to pass #VAWA. Now the measure moves to the Senate were we must continue the fight for enactment!

Estaba muy orgulloso de conocer a los futuros abogados de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Puerto Rico, Facultad de Derecho. Recuerde, la cualidad más importante de un líder es la autenticidad. Te deseo la mejor de las suertes en tu camino a la justicia. pic.twitter.com/KQjQJ1H7yp

I was so proud to meet the future lawyers of Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico School of Law. Remember, the most important quality of a leader is authenticity. I wish you the best of luck on your justice journey. pic.twitter.com/aHawou6Oky

Today, I join my colleagues in voting yes on S.J.Res 7 to remove unauthorized U.S. forces from #Yemen. The Constitution assigns war powers to the legislative branch, & that is exactly why Congress must make clear its views on U.S. participation in the Yemeni civil war.
My thanks to @errollouis & @InsideCityHall for having me on to discuss among other things the need to provide relief & aid to #PuertoRico. pic.twitter.com/0kW87y2qHC

Was heartbroken to hear of this fire in Sunset Park. My staff is helping displaced families. If you know anyone affected you may refer them to my office for additional help. My thanks to the first responders who contained the fire at great personal risk. https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/5-Alarm-Fire-Tears-Through-Brooklyn-Building-FDNY-508073241.html …

Victory for taxpayers -- and kittens! Proud to have worked with my colleagues to put an end to the @USDA's wasteful, cruel and unnecessary taxpayer-funded kitten testing. No more #kittens or #cats will be harmed by the USDA! https://www.npr.org/2019/04/02/709273861/usda-terminates-deadly-cat-experiments-plans-to-adopt-out-remaining-animals …
My thanks to @SenWarren @SenGillibrand @SenSchumer @SenMarkey @RepJoseSerrano @SenBlumenthal @RepRaulGrijalva @RepAOC & others for joining this effort!

Led colleagues in writing Puerto Rico Financial Oversight Board asking they recoup fees that were paid out for issuing bonds since found to be illegitimate. Those resources could keep schools open, fund nutritional programs or keep hospitals running! #PeopleFirst pic.twitter.com/MkXyXTCa5j

.@realDonaldTrump should stop distorting the facts and misleading the American people about #PuertoRico.  Thousands of American citizens lost their lives there after Maria & Irma in no small part due to your Administration's shamefully inadequate response! https://wapo.st/2YJQiW9

Thank you to @democracynow for having me on today to discuss, among other items, #PuertoRico and the need for Senate Republicans to pass a supplemental aid package.  We can not allow our fellow citizens to continue to suffer! https://www.democracynow.org/shows/2019/4/2
It’s outrageous that women are paid less than men in New York. I’m fighting to close the gender #paygap. #EqualPay #EqualPayDay https://nyti.ms/2I2gZzv

.@hogangidley45, I'm sure you realize the residents of "that country" are American citizens who have fought, shed blood and died in our armed forces for the freedoms the rest of us enjoy. https://twitter.com/justinbaragona/status/1113086478396088322 …

Pay equity is not only a moral imperative, it is critical to boost women’s financial security. Based on today’s wage gap, a woman who worked full-time, year-round would lose $406,760 over a 40-year career.  #EqualPay #PaycheckFairnessAct. #EqualPayDay

With House passage of the #PaycheckFairness Act, we are one step closer to ensuring that every woman can take home the pay she rightfully earns. It's time for the Senate to act on #EqualPay and pass the Paycheck Fairness Act. #EqualPayDay

Too many communities, especially low income and communities of color, lack access to clean water. The #DirtyWaterRule will only make the situation worse. We must oppose this dangerous rule and #ProtectCleanWater

.@EPAAWheeler’s insistence that climate change & access to safe drinking water are unrelated sends the message that he puts the interest of industry before the safety of families & future generations." #ProtectCleanWater #ActOnClimate https://bit.ly/2TZXpuU

Thanks to our great witnesses for testifying today in support of my legislation. @natfairhouse @LGBTQTaskForce pic.twitter.com/CamL9tdtwh

Today I'm proud to vote yes on H.Res 271 condemning @realDonaldTrump's attack on health care. The Protecting Pre-Existing Conditions & Making Health Care More Affordable Act of 2019 is essential to providing American families with access to lower-cost health care! #ProtectOurCare

Rather than trying to shortchange Puerto Rico, GOP Senators like @SenRickScott should go the Senate Republican Leadership & ask them to approve the House-passed emergency bill. 

We cannot leave our fellow citizens in #PuertoRico behind!

We need climate policy #ForthePeople, not the polluters. We need #ClimateActionNow and that’s why we introduced #HR9.  https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2019/03/29/extreme-weather-fueled-climate-change-disasters-hit-62-m-last-year/3304707002/ … via @usatoday
